title_sort: mannahatta "hattie" whitman to walt whitman, 1 march 1870
title: Mannahatta "Hattie" Whitman to Walt Whitman, 1 March 1870
text: St LouisMarch 1th 1870Dear UncleMama is away and we are getting along very well with out her I want to see mama and papa very much I thought when she went away I could never get along with out her but the time passed away and she will soon be back.I got the book you sent me and I am very much oblighed[obliged] for it papa is coming home fridayI go to school and I study Geography Spelling arithmetic and Reading when mama comes back I will have more to writeMama wrote me that she was going to see you and if she is there tell her to stay as long as longas long as she can that we are geting[getting] along very well with out her and us this is all I have to say good by from your loving neice[niece]Hattie Whitman Mannahatta "Hattie" Whitman to Walt Whitman, 1 March 1870
